snippet: Both parties have seen new opportunities and new challenges, but Democrats appear to be in less danger of losing the Senate, while Republicans have a more difficult path to gaining the majority.
abstract: Fight for the United States Senate has shifted significantly, with fierce races breaking out in states where they were not expected and other contests dimming that were once ablaze with competition; Democrats now appear to be in less danger of losing the Senate, while Republicans have a more difficult path to gaining the majority.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JENNIFER STEINHAUER

lead_paragraph: Both parties have seen new opportunities and new challenges, but Democrats appear to be in less danger of losing the Senate, while Republicans have a more difficult path to gaining the majority.

headline.seo: Senate Control Is Up in the Air as Races Shift
headline.main: Missteps and Surprises Turn Battle for the Senate Into a Guessing Game
headline.print_headline: Missteps and Surprises Turn Battle for the Senate Into a Guessing Game
